TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit InertiaExpansionBehavior2D extends System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaParameters2D
Public NotInheritable Class InertiaExpansionBehavior2D Inherits InertiaParameters2D

Docs.summary: Describes desired expansion behavior of an inertia processor.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float DesiredDeceleration { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.DesiredDeceleration : single with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the desired expansion deceleration, in coordinate units per millisecond squared.
Docs.value: The desired expansion deceleration, in coordinate units per millisecond squared.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property value is mutually exclusive with the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.DesiredExpansionX%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.DesiredExpansionY%2A> properties; setting this property will set <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.DesiredExpansionX%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.DesiredExpansionY%2A> to `NaN`.
The default value for this property is `NaN`.
This property cannot be set while the inertia processor is running; otherwise, an exception is thrown.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float DesiredExpansionX { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.DesiredExpansionX : single with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the desired expansion along the x-axis, in coordinate units.
Docs.value: The desired expansion along the x-axis, in coordinate units.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Expansion must be proportional. The value of this property must equal the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.DesiredExpansionY%2A> property when the inertia processor starts; otherwise an exception is thrown.
This property value is mutually exclusive with the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.DesiredDeceleration%2A> property; setting this property will set <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.DesiredDeceleration%2A> to `NaN`.
The default value for this property is `NaN`.
<xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.DesiredExpansionX%2A> must be a finite, non-negative number. The rate of expansion is determined by the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.InitialVelocityX%2A> property.
This property cannot be set while the inertia processor is running; otherwise, an exception is thrown.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float DesiredExpansionY { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.DesiredExpansionY : single with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the desired expansion along the y-axis, in coordinate units.
Docs.value: The desired expansion along the y-axis, in coordinate units.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Expansion must be proportional. The value of this property must equal the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.DesiredExpansionX%2A> property when the inertia processor starts; otherwise an exception is thrown.
This property value is mutually exclusive with the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.DesiredDeceleration%2A> property; setting this property will set <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.DesiredDeceleration%2A> to `NaN`.
The default value for this property is `NaN`.
<xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.DesiredExpansionY%2A> must be a finite, non-negative number. The rate of expansion is determined by the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.InitialVelocityY%2A> property.
This property cannot be set while the inertia processor is running; otherwise, an exception is thrown.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float InitialRadius { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.InitialRadius : single with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the initial average radius, in coordinate units.
Docs.value: The initial average radius, in coordinate units.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is used by the inertia processor to calculate the scale factor for an element that is expanding.
For instance, if the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.InitialVelocityX%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.InitialVelocityY%2A> properties are set to 3.75, this informs the inertia processor that the starting expansion velocity is 3.75 coordinate units per millisecond along both axes (expansion must be proportional).
The scale factor associated with this rate of expansion depends upon the size of the element that is expanding. For a small element, this expansion velocity represents a larger scale factor than for a large element. You inform the inertia processor of the element size by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.InitialRadius%2A> property.
The default value for the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.InitialRadius%2A> property is 1.0.
Valid values are any finite number greater than or equal to 1.0.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float InitialVelocityX { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.InitialVelocityX : single with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the initial expansion velocity along the x-axis, in coordinate units per millisecond.
Docs.value: The initial expansion velocity along the x-axis, in coordinate units per millisecond.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Expansion must be proportional. The value of this property must equal the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.InitialVelocityY%2A> property when the inertia processor starts; otherwise an exception is thrown.
The default value for this property is `NaN`. Leaving this property and <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.InitialVelocityY%2A> unchanged from the default or setting this property and <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.InitialVelocityY%2A> to zero (0) will disable expansion inertia.
This property cannot be set while the inertia processor is running; otherwise, an exception is thrown.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float InitialVelocityY { float get(); void set(float value); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the initial expansion velocity along the y-axis, in coordinate units per millisecond.
Docs.value: The initial expansion velocity along the y-axis, in coordinate units per millisecond.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Expansion must be proportional. The value of this property must equal the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.InitialVelocityX%2A> property when the inertia processor starts; otherwise an exception is thrown.
The default value for this property is `NaN`. Leaving this property and <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.InitialVelocityX%2A> unchanged from the default or setting this property and <xref:System.Windows.Input.Manipulations.InertiaExpansionBehavior2D.InitialVelocityX%2A> to zero (0) will disable expansion inertia.
This property cannot be set while the inertia processor is running; otherwise, an exception is thrown.
